DUT.Table: CREATE TABLE DUTs ( Id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, Name TEXT, ExpectValue DOUBLE, Description TEXT, CreateTime DATETIME, ImagePath TEXT, ReportPath TEXT ); CREATE INDEX DUTs_Id ON DUTs(Id);
DUT.Insert: INSERT INTO DUTs ( Id, Name, ExpectValue, Description, CreateTime, ImagePath, ReportPath ) Values ( @Id, @Name, @ExpectValue, @Description, @CreateTime, @ImagePath, @ReportPath );
DUT.Update: UPDATE DUTs SET Id=@Id, Name=@Name, ExpectValue=@ExpectValue, Description=@Description, CreateTime=@CreateTime, ImagePath=@ImagePath, ReportPath=@ReportPath;

Engineering.Table: CREATE TABLE Engineerings ( Id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, Name TEXT, Description TEXT, CreateTime DATETIME, Path TEXT, Commands ); CREATE INDEX Engineerings_Id ON Engineerings(Id);
Engineering.Insert: INSERT INTO Engineerings ( Id, Name, Description, CreateTime, Path, Commands ) Values ( @Id, @Name, @Description, @CreateTime, @Path, @Commands );
Engineering.Update: UPDATE Engineerings SET Id=@Id, Name=@Name, Description=@Description, CreateTime=@CreateTime, Path=@Path, Commands=@Commands;

MeasureData.Table: CREATE TABLE MeasureDatas ( Time DATETIME PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, Data DOUBLE, Flag TEXT, FuncValue DOUBLE, Note TEXT ); CREATE INDEX MeasureDatas_Time ON MeasureDatas(Time);
MeasureData.Insert: INSERT INTO MeasureDatas ( Time, Data, Flag, FuncValue, Note ) Values ( @Time, @Data, @Flag, @FuncValue, @Note );
MeasureData.Update: UPDATE MeasureDatas SET Time=@Time, Data=@Data, Flag=@Flag, FuncValue=@FuncValue, Note=@Note;

Slot.Table: CREATE TABLE Slots ( Id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, SlotType TINYINT, Config TEXT );
Slot.Insert: INSERT INTO Slots ( Id, SlotType, Config ) Values ( @Id, @SlotType, @Config );
Slot.Update: UPDATE Slots SET Id=@Id, SlotType=@SlotType, Config=@Config;

Instrument.Table: CREATE TABLE Instruments ( Id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, Manufacturer TEXT, UseClassification TEXT, Model1 TEXT, Model2 TEXT, Name TEXT, AbbrName TEXT, Information TEXT, Image ); CREATE INDEX Instruments_Id ON Instruments(Id);
Instrument.Insert: INSERT INTO Instruments ( Id, Manufacturer, UseClassification, Model1, Model2, Name, AbbrName, Information, Image ) Values ( @Id, @Manufacturer, @UseClassification, @Model1, @Model2, @Name, @AbbrName, @Information, @Image );
Instrument.Update: UPDATE Instruments SET Id=@Id, Manufacturer=@Manufacturer, UseClassification=@UseClassification, Model1=@Model1, Model2=@Model2, Name=@Name, AbbrName=@AbbrName, Information=@Information, Image=@Image;

DUT.Insert: INSERT INTO DUTs ( Id, Name, ExpectValue, Description, CreateTime, ImagePath, ReportPath ) Values ( @Id, @Name, @ExpectValue, @Description, @CreateTime, @ImagePath, @ReportPath );
DUT.Update: UPDATE DUTs SET Id=@Id, Name=@Name, ExpectValue=@ExpectValue, Description=@Description, CreateTime=@CreateTime, ImagePath=@ImagePath, ReportPath=@ReportPath;

Engineering.Insert: INSERT INTO Engineerings ( Id, Name, Description, CreateTime, Path, Commands ) Values ( @Id, @Name, @Description, @CreateTime, @Path, @Commands );
Engineering.Update: UPDATE Engineerings SET Id=@Id, Name=@Name, Description=@Description, CreateTime=@CreateTime, Path=@Path, Commands=@Commands;

MeasureData.Table: CREATE TABLE MeasureDatas ( Time DATETIME PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, Data DOUBLE, Flag TEXT, FuncValue DOUBLE, Note TEXT ); CREATE INDEX MeasureDatas_Time ON MeasureDatas(Time);
MeasureData.Insert: INSERT INTO MeasureDatas ( Time, Data, Flag, FuncValue, Note ) Values ( @Time, @Data, @Flag, @FuncValue, @Note );

Slot.Table: CREATE TABLE Slots ( Id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, SlotType SMALLINT, Config TEXT );
Slot.Insert: INSERT INTO Slots ( Id, SlotType, Config ) Values ( @Id, @SlotType, @Config );
Slot.Update: UPDATE Slots SET Id=@Id, SlotType=@SlotType, Config=@Config;

Instrument.Insert: INSERT INTO Instruments ( Id, Manufacturer, UseClassification, Model1, Model2, Name, AbbrName, Information, Image ) Values ( @Id, @Manufacturer, @UseClassification, @Model1, @Model2, @Name, @AbbrName, @Information, @Image );
